simulator.title: Compliance Simulator - AgileVizion
simulator.hero_title: Which cybersecurity regulations apply to you?
simulator.hero_text: Answer a few questions and immediately discover which frameworks are applicable or recommended for your organisation.
simulator.q1_label: Where is your headquarters / main activity located?*
simulator.q1_option_eu_clients: Outside EU but clients/users in the EU
simulator.disclaimer: This simulator provides general guidance and does not constitute legal advice.
simulator.q2_label: What is your main business sector?*
simulator.q3_label: What is the size of your organisation?*
simulator.q3_hint: NIS 2: <50 employees AND <‚Ç¨10M = not concerned. One threshold exceeded is enough.
simulator.q4_label: Do you process personal data?*
simulator.q4_hint: Name, email, phone, IP, cookies, HR data, customer files... 95% of companies = Yes
simulator.q5_label: Do you hold a financial license (AMF, ACPR, CSSF...)?*
simulator.q5_hint: DORA targets exclusively regulated financial entities. The "banking/finance" sector is NOT enough without a license!
simulator.q6_label: Do you provide IT/Cloud services to clients?*
simulator.q6_hint: MSP, managed services, SaaS, hosting, IT consulting...
simulator.conditional_subtitle: These questions refine your diagnostic based on your profile
simulator.q7_label: Are you an ICT provider for regulated financial entities?
simulator.q7_hint: Critical IT subcontractor for banks, insurers, SGP... ‚Üí DORA applies
simulator.q8_label: Do you host health data for third parties (clients)?
simulator.q8_hint: For clients (hospitals, doctors, clinics). NOT your own internal data.
simulator.q9_label: Do you store/process bank card numbers (PAN)?
simulator.q9_hint: NOT applicable if you use Stripe/PayPal without ever seeing the numbers.
simulator.q10_label: Do you have activities or clients in the United States?*
simulator.q10a_label: Do your US clients require certifications (ISO 27001 / SOC 2)?
simulator.q10b_label: Do you work with the US Department of Defense (DoD)?
simulator.q11_label: Do you have critical activities requiring a business continuity plan?*
simulator.continuity_note: NIS 2 / DORA requires business continuity measures (Art. 21). A plan will be required even if you don't have one yet.
simulator.q12_hint: Activities whose interruption would have a major impact on your business or clients

rgpd.sanctions: Up to ‚Ç¨20M or 4% of annual global turnover (whichever is higher)

dora.sanctions: Periodic penalties + possible license withdrawal by supervisory authority

nis2.sanctions: Essential Entities: up to ‚Ç¨10M or 2% turnover | Important Entities: up to ‚Ç¨7M or 1.4% turnover

pcidss.fullName: Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard
pcidss.sanctions: $5K-10K/month (months 1-3), $25-50K/month (months 4-6), up to $100K/month beyond + card processing capability withdrawal

hds.sanctions: 3 years imprisonment + ‚Ç¨45,000 (individuals) / ‚Ç¨225,000 (legal entities) + CNIL fines up to 4% turnover

iso27001.sanctions: Loss of contracts, exclusion from tenders, loss of customer trust

iso20000.sanctions: Loss of commercial differentiation, competitive disadvantage

soc2.sanctions: Loss of US/international clients, exclusion from Fortune 500 procurement processes

iso22301.sanctions: Risk of prolonged interruption, financial losses, reputation damage

cmmc.sanctions: Exclusion from DoD markets + False Claims Act fines up to $250K/violation + triple damages
